title: Introduction to Vocal Anatomy and Physiology

questions.question: What is the primary function of the vocal folds?
Where is the larynx located?
Which of the following is NOT a cartilage found in the larynx?
What is the function of the diaphragm in singing?
Which breathing technique is often emphasized in vocal training?
What is the term for the voice box?
Which of the following is NOT a resonating cavity for the voice?
What gives each voice its unique timbre?
choices: The color of the vocal folds

questions.question: Which muscle separates the chest and abdominal cavities?
What is the purpose of the arytenoid cartilages?
choices: To adjust the tension of vocal folds
questions.answer: To adjust the tension of vocal folds

questions.question: Which part of the respiratory system is directly responsible for drawing air into the lungs?
What is the term for the coming together of the vocal folds?
Which of the following is a common vocal health practice?
What is the 'Adam's apple'?
Which of the following is NOT part of the upper respiratory tract?
What controls the pitch of the voice?
choices: The tension and length of vocal folds
questions.answer: The tension and length of vocal folds

questions.question: Which of the following is a traditional Timorese vocal health remedy mentioned in the course materials?
choices: Using steam inhalation with eucalyptus leaves
Eating spicy food to clear the throat
questions.answer: Using steam inhalation with eucalyptus leaves

questions.question: What is the primary muscle of respiration?
Which of the following is NOT a benefit of diaphragmatic breathing for singers?
What is the function of the epiglottis?
choices: To prevent food from entering the trachea
questions.answer: To prevent food from entering the trachea

questions.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of proper diaphragmatic breathing?
choices: Expanding the lower ribcage and abdomen
Holding the breath for long periods
questions.answer: Expanding the lower ribcage and abdomen

questions.question: What is the term for the separation of the vocal folds?
Which of the following is NOT a factor that contributes to the final quality of the voice?
What is the primary function of the lungs in vocal production?
Which of the following is a common misconception about vocal health?
choices: Warming up before singing is important
Whispering is good for a sore throat
Avoiding excessive throat clearing is recommended
questions.answer: Whispering is good for a sore throat

questions.question: What is the role of the soft palate in vocal production?
choices: To control airflow through the nose
questions.answer: To control airflow through the nose

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a part of the lower respiratory tract?
What is the term for the enrichment of vocal tone by the air-filled cavities above the larynx?
Which of the following is a recommended practice for vocal health?
What is the primary function of the intrinsic laryngeal muscles?
choices: To shape the mouth for vowel sounds
